title: Gold Coast Securities opens branch at KNUST
text:
11 July 2015 23:00 CET Gold Coast Securities opens branch at KNUST By GNA 
Kumasi, July 11, GNA - The Deputy Regional Manager of the Bank of Ghana (BOG) in Kumasi, Mr. Akuoko Ankrah, has cautioned the people to be careful about where they put their money. 
He said they should not be swayed by the often 'too good to be true stories' told by fake financial institutions, to put their money in dubious investments that would make them regret later. 
He was speaking at the inauguration of a branch of Gold Coast Securities Limited (GCSL) at the Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology (KNUST) in Kumasi. 
The launch of the new branch brings to 16, the number of outlets it has nationwide. 
GCSL is a member of the Groupe Nduom (GN) and as fund managers and investment advisers, it has been active on the money market. 
It has been providing a wide range of services and products including fixed income securities, long term growth of capital and current income, liquidity, equity market and pension fund management. 
Mr. Ankrah encouraged all particularly the youth to invest but said they needed to be smart to be assured of a secured future. 
The General Manager of GCSL, Mr. Boakye Mensah, said its KNUST branch would focus on mutual funds including fixed income securities that would earn clients the highest returns. 
He said the company would continue to work with zeal to aid the people to make the right investment decisions for maximum returns. 
The Gold Coast Fund, Gold brokerage and Pentrust are among products that would be on offer, he added. 
GNA
